definition: shaking in fear/one's heart palpitating with fear
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: "Some were thrilled that Caesar had died, and some were horrified, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “對於凱撒的死，有人激動，有人驚悸，”他講道。

sentences.english: The enlightened man highlighted his mighty insight into the fright.
sentences.chinese: 開明的人強調了他對驚悸的強大洞察力。

sentences.english: Whose ghosts scare victor kings in their ancestral towers.
sentences.chinese: 祖傳的古堡，其幽靈使得勝的君王驚悸。

definition: impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
(TCM) plum-pit qi, a feeling of a lump in the throat (globus pharyngis) or of stagnant phlegm
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
